opportunities.description: On behalf of Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), GSA is conducting market research.  To respond to this RFI, copy and paste the below link into a new browser.  Only responses submitted through the linked RFI will be accepted. Nothing else will be evaluated or recorded (this includes selecting 'interested' within eBuy).   Link to RFI: https://feedback.gsa.gov/jfe/form/SV_eMer6FlqbhBazSS   Important Notice: Due to the structure of contracts in GSA eBuy, you may receive multiple Sources Sought or RFQ notifications for the same requirement if it falls under multiple of your company's awarded SINs. However, please note that you are only required to respond to the RFI once.  Be sure to use the URL provided above to submit your response.   Note: If the link does not work, try clearing your browser history (cache) and then copying and pasting the link into a new browser.  Questions regarding this RFI will be responded to by email only. Send your inquiry to: rfi@research.gsa.gov - be sure to include the RFQ number.
opportunities.title: HHS FDA - PRIMARY BARRIER EQUIPMENT SERVICES - MRAS (RFI)

opportunities.description: The Internal Revenue Service is seeking quotes for the Business Online Accounts and Clean Energy O&M Support Services Requirement. BTA and Clean Energy Programs, AGILE Technology/Web Application (WebApps) support Services\" requirement seeking support for this task order; the scope is for high performing Operation and Maintenance (O&M) teams to provide software O&M development support. The contractor shall provide technical method, techniques, and concepts that are innovative, practical, cost effective, and conducive to Agile/Iterative Application Development, testing, and delivery. The contractor shall support applications based on their original requirements that may require enhancements, updates and fixes as the business climate shifts. It is expected that all code developed by the teams will be for enhancements or critical changes to existing functionality as identified and prioritized by the Government product owners.  All inquiries must be received no later than 5:00pm EST on Thursday, April 3rd 2025.   Although the Government established an inquiry submission date, the agency may not respond to every question received. If IRS does respond to questions, it will do so via an amendment to the solicitation. Additionally, questions shall be submitted via eBuy by the stated date and time above.   Contractors must submit quotations using the eBuy web portal before the solicitation closing date and time. All quotations are due no later than before 5:00pm EST on Wednesday, March 20th, 2025. This solicitation requires electronic submission (via eBuy) of quotations. Any quotation, modification, revision, or  withdrawal of a quotation received after the exact time specified for receipt of quotations is \"late\" and will not be considered.

opportunities.description:
The Department of Veteran Affairs (VA) Veterans Benefits Administration (VBA) Medical Disability Examination Office (MDEO) contracts with Vendors (hereby referenced as contract exam vendors) to perform Compensation and Pension (C&P) disability examinations for Veterans. All Vendor examiners are required to complete specific certification and supplemental trainings prior to performing Medical Disability Examinations (MDEs). Once certified, all Vendor examiners are required to complete additional ad-hoc training as deemed required by MDEO.
*SB*

opportunities.description:
355 Contracting Squadron (CONS) is soliciting for one senior contract specialist and up to three intermediate contract specialists to provide in-person contract support at 355 CONS located on Davis-Monthan AFB in Tucson, Arizona. The attached Contracting Support Solicitation gives additional information regarding this solicitation, evaluation criteria, and evaluation methodology. Contractors are encouraged to fully review all attached documents to ensure full understanding of the solicitation. A contractor's failure to provide documentation in accordance with the attached solicitation documents will result in the offer to be considered non-responsive. Key Dates Questions are due by 1 April 2025 at 5:00PM EST Answers will be provided by 4 April 2025 at 5:00 PM EST Quotes are due by 15 April 2025 at 1:00 PM EST Primary POC for this action is SSgt Edilberto Sampang, edilberto.sampang@us.af.mil, 520-228-5461. Secondary POC is Jeremy Dedmon, jeremy.dedmon@us.af.mil, 520-228-4180.
*SB*
opportunities.procurement: Update from Government site: 1. 03/25/2025 - Update the PPQ to change the scope of work to, "The scope of work includes efforts involve the recruitment, placement, andnretention of contract specialists." In the event a contractor returns a PPQ with the previous verbiage it will be accepted by the government as long as the work can be determined to be in-scope.nnAdditionally, updates the verbiage in the Contracting Support Services attachment, Addendum to 52.212-2 Evaluation-Commercial Items, paragraph 2 Basis for Contract Award. Change allows the government to rank by price and stop evaluating after a technically acceptable quote with substantial confidence. Please review for full text.

opportunities.description: REQUEST FOR QUOTE | OPEN SEASON for DOJ's Rapid Technology Services (RTS) Multiple Award BPA   The Department of Justice (DOJ) seeks to establish a multiple Blanket Purchase Agreements (BPA) with vendors to provide information technology (IT) services to support the requirement for low-code, rapid application development. The Department would like to expand the existing RTS BPA to include additional IT services that:  1. Go beyond sustaining and expanding use of current hardware, operating systems and software.   2. Increase business effectiveness and automation through the effective use and adoption of systems by leveraging new technologies and applications, best practices, and software.   3. Create new applications and introduce new technologies as they emerge.   4. Give expert assistance in configuring and managing computer hardware, software and networks, in training users, and in improving systems and network security.   5. Facilitate business change and flexibility by architecting, designing, and developing solutions that enable the rapid realization of new or changed requirements.   6. Protect the business by ensuring that systems, applications, data and practices are secure.   7. Measure and continually improve customer service and satisfaction.   SEE FULL STATEMENT OF WORK ATTACHED.

opportunities.description: The scope of the PWS is to provide the Command, Control, Communication, Computer, Cyber and Intelligence Service Center (C5ISC) Engineering Services Division (ESD) Certified TEMPEST Technical Authority (CTTA) with the necessary service support in the areas of TEMPEST Certification on Recapitalization Program assets for CG-9335, CG-9322, CG-9324 and CG-9326 supported efforts. As well, as provide C5ISC with the necessary service support to assist the United States Coast Guard (USCG) C5ISC in Coast Guard TEMPEST Field Technical Authority (FTA) duties. The Contractor must provide technical and security management services for the area of certification by conducting TEMPEST testing, visual assessments, and performing documentation support services, and related training and Subject Matter Expert support for CG-9335, CG-9322, CG-9324 and CG-9326 programs of record including systems on the NSC, OPC, PSC, FRC, MRS, and LRS. The Contractor must provide FTA support, technical; generate reports and discrepancy lists; assist with help desk support for TEMPEST questions; Conduct Visual TEMPEST Inspections (VTI); evaluate C4IT systems for TEMPEST vulnerabilities and recommending countermeasures and generate VTI reports. Tasks must be performed to address the protection of all Classified USCG networks, systems, and information they contain, including secure voice/data, and Secret Internet Protocol Router Network (SIPRNET), and the Joint Worldwide Intelligence Communications System (JWICS). The activation of JWICS is not required for the Contractor to perform the VTI (SCI is not required).  Per the attachments and exhibits attached below.

opportunities.description:
Product Service Description: Conexus Plexus Maintenance Support. The service known as the Plexus Vision Asset Tracking System Maintenance is for the Irwin Army Community Hospital located at Ft. Riley, KS. Plexus is a logistic software program that is designed to track the movement of serialized assets. The three main components of the Conexus maintenance requirement are: (1) Help Desk which covers the Plexus Help Desk (24/7 coverage except Federal holidays), which includes general user support for software questions or troubleshooting, as well as System Administrator support, (2) Software Updates which covers any software updates required to maintain compliance with DoD accreditations and subject matter experts capable of addressing Cybersecurity or Information Assurance (IA) concerns or questions in relation the Plexus system, and (3) On-Site Support (Two 3-day On-Site visits) which covers Conexus site visits to IACH at least twice throughout the period of performance to ensure the system is functioning properly and that new users of the system receive adequate training and support through a variety of methods. Those methods include training sessions for new and/or existing Plexus users through classroom training, RTLS calibration support, inventory scanning, hardware troubleshooting, and other tasks as agreed upon with the Project Manager. The Project Manager is assigned to IACH site and is the coordinator for any on-site activity. NAICS 513210 Please see Attach documents PWS Wage Determination Solicitation Document Please send solicitation information to: Phyllis Senn phyllis.m.senn.civ@army.mil Teams (520) 944-7308 Sheila Banks sheila.a.banks.civ@army.mil Teams (520) 944 2224
*SB*

opportunities.description: Service Delivery requirement provides a full range of IT products, services, solutions, and user support to the Office of the Secretary of Defense (OSD) to meet mission and business requirements. Service Delivery requirement also provides advice and assistance to senior managers to ensure IT and information resources are managed in a manner that implements Department of Defense (DOD) policies, procedures established priorities.  IT Services and Support to include the following: 1. Very Important Person Support 2. Tier I Call Center Support 3. Tier II Deskside and Remote Support 4. End User Training 5. Strategic Messaging to the J6 Supported Users 6. Boards, Commissions, and Task Force/Operations Service Request Support 7. Wireless Services Support 8. Telecommunications Services Support 9. Customer Relations Management Support 10. Macintosh Support 11. Assistive Technology Support for Users with Disabilities  The Government will use evaluation factors to determine a contractor's relative ability to accomplish the tasks set forth in the PWS. See attachment, RFQ 832268923 Service Delivery, Paragraph 3, Evaluation Factors and Basis for Award Determination.  Questions shall be submitted to john.m.ross138.civ@mail.mil. Please provide any questions, in writing using Attachment 9 RFQ Questions and Answers, no later than Monday, April 7, 2025, at 2:00pm CT. The Government reserves the right to not answer questions submitted after this time.
opportunities.title: SERVICE DELIVERY

opportunities.description: Radio Helpdesk & DAS Support The United States Capitol Police (USCP) has a requirement for Helpdesk Support Services for the Office of Information Systems (OIS). You are hereby requested to submit a price quote for customer support / service desk coverage between 6am and 6pm during normal days of operation. The hours of coverage for the radio technician providing distributed antenna system (DAS) support and maintenance services shall be an eight (8) hour period between the hours of 6am and 6pm, with an unpaid lunch break. There is no possibility of teleworking for the customer support / service desk positions or the DAS radio technician.  The United States Capitol Police (USCP) intends to procure services under a Firm Fixed-Price type arrangement placed against the applicable GSA Schedule Contract. The USCP anticipates award of one Task Order for the Helpdesk Support Services for the Office of Information Systems with a base period and four one year options periods from June 6, 2025, through June 5, 2030.

opportunities.title: HELPDESK SUPPORT SERVICES

opportunities.description:
Under the anticipated Blanket Purchase Agreement (BPA), which will contain the provision to issue FFP, T&M/LH or Hybrid Orders, the successful BPA quoters must provide Web Agility Program Support Services (WA3), as described in Section 3 - Statement of Work (SOW). As a result of this RFQ, the FHWA anticipates awarding approximately four small business BPA awards but may increase or decrease this amount based on quotes deemed the best value to the Government. Quotations will be submitted in two phases for this Solicitation. The Phase I quotation submission will consist of a single Technical Quotation volume. The Phase II quotation submission will include a Technical Quotation, and a Business Quotation. The Business Quotation will contain labor categories and labor rates for the resultant BPA awards. The SOW for the BPA is in Section 3 of this RFQ. All other quotation requirements are outlined in Section 36, Contents of Quotations.
*SB*

We are extending to allow additional time for the Government's review and response to the Q&As. 3. 03/03/2025 - The purpose of Amendment 3 is to allow additional time for the Government to respond to the questions received by interested contractors and to update the Contract Specialist listed on the RFQ. 4. 03/24/2025 - The purpose of this Amendment 4 is to update the RFQ document and post the Questions and Answers (Q&As).
